meanings.definition: To break up or roughen the surface of (a material) by chiseling or hammering.
meanings.sent1: The workers were scabbling the old concrete to prepare it for a new layer.
meanings.sent2: The mason scabbled the stone to create a textured finish.
meanings.sent3: The noisy scabbling in the construction site sounded like a rhythmic drumbeat.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like someone was scabbling away at it, trying to uncover buried memories.
meanings.sent5: The artist scabbled the clay with passion, shaping it into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A rough surface produced by scabbling.
meanings.sent1: The scabbling on the wall made it difficult to paint smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The scabbling on the floor caused the wheels of the cart to jolt.
meanings.sent3: The scabbling on the rock resembled a natural artwork.
meanings.sent4: The scabbling on the metal gave it an industrial look.
meanings.sent5: The scabbling on the wood felt rough to the touch.
